document.docAuthor: Kuş, Sevgi, Kurt, Güley & Çinar, Melih Ertan
document.masterDocTitle: Nephtyidae (Annelida: Polychaeta) from the Sea of Marmara and Black Sea, with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nephtyidae (Annelida: Polychaeta) from the Sea of Marmara and Black Sea, with descriptions of two new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Sinop University, Institute of Natural and Applied Sciences, Sinop, Turkey

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Nephthys longicornis Perejaslavtseva, 1891: 248–249
, pl. VII, Figs. 2a–c .

Figs. 1-3 ;
Laborda 2004: 416
, Figs. 152A–C.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Micronephthys longicornis
(ESFM-POL/2019-41). A, Anterior end, with pharynx everted, dorsal view; B, Jaw; C, Shape of dorsal cirri from anterior to posterior (left to right); D, General view of parapodia (chaetiger 30), anterior view; E, Dentate chaeta of chaetiger 1; F, Lyrate chaeta; G, Barred chaeta; H, Spinulated chaeta. Scale bars: A, D, 0.1 mm; B, 0,1 mm; C, 0.01 mm; E, 40 µm; F, 10 µm; G, 25 µm; H, 35 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Acicula light brown with a straight tip in anterior and middle parapodia, having curved tip in posterior parapodia, numbering one in per ramus.
Pygidium rounded with one digitiform anal cirrus placed dorsally, as long as last 2–3 chaetigers.

Remarks. The Sea of Marmara and the Black Sea specimens of
Micronephthys longicornis
matches the original description and redescriptions.

Habitat. It was found in muddy and sandy bottom, up to 72 m depth in the present study. It was found in soft substratum at shallower depths (3.6– 7 m ) in the Mediterranean Sea ( San Martin 1982 ; Laborda 2004 ), and up to 47.4 m in the Black Sea (
Kurt-Şahin et al. 2017a
, b; Dnestrovskaya & Jirkov 2019 ). It was also reported in beds of the brown alga
Cystoseira crinita Duby, 1830
from the Sinop Peninsula ( Kuş & Kurt-Şahin, 2016 ).
